meanings.definition: Hardened plates or pieces forming the exoskeleton of an arthropod.
meanings.sent1: The sclerites on the beetle's back provided protection.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the sclerites of insects to understand their anatomy.
meanings.sent3: The ant joked that its sclerites were like tiny shields in battle.
meanings.sent4: The sclerites of the crab were compared to a suit of armor.
meanings.sent5: The shiny sclerites of the beetle gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Small, hard, chitinous structures found in the integument of certain invertebrates.
meanings.sent1: Careful examination revealed the sclerites on the insect's body.
meanings.sent2: The sclerites of the shrimp help protect it from predators.
meanings.sent3: The tiny sclerites on the worm's skin looked like miniature shields.
meanings.sent4: The sclerites of the beetle were as tough as little pebbles.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns on the sclerites of the insect were fascinating to observe.
